revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software | name = Firefox for mobile | logo = [[File:Firefox 3.5-4.0 logo.png|100px]] | screenshot = [[File:Firefox Mobile 4.0 RC1 displaying en.wikipedia.org.png|180px]] | caption = Firefox for mobile 4.0 RC1 displaying [[Wikipedia]] | developer = Mozilla Corporation
[[Mozilla Foundation]] | frequently updated = Yes | operating system = [[Maemo (operating system)|Maemo]]
[[Windows Mobile 6.0]] Professional or greater
[[Android (operating system)|Android]] 2.0 and above{{cite web|url=https://wiki.mozilla.org/Mobile/Platforms|title=wiki.mozilla.org/Mobile/Platforms }} | programming language = [[C++]], [[XUL]] | genre = [[Mobile browser]] | download = 14.9MB [[Maemo]] | license = [[Mozilla Public License|MPL]] 1.1 or later
[[GNU GPL]] 2.0 or later
[[GNU LGPL]] 2.1 or later{{cite web|url=http://hg.mozilla.org/mobile-browser/file/9aa835472fed/LICENSE |title=mobile-browser: LICENSE@9aa835472fed |publisher=Hg.mozilla.org |date= |accessdate=2010-08-11}} | website = http://www.mozilla.com/mobile/ }} '''Firefox for mobile''' (codenamed '''Fennec''') is the name of the build of the [[Firefox|Mozilla Firefox]] [[web browser]] for devices such as [[mobile phone]]s and [[personal digital assistant]]s (PDAs). Firefox for mobile versions use the same [[Gecko (layout engine)|Gecko]] [[layout engine]] as their Firefox counterparts. For example, version 1.0 used the same engine as Firefox 3.6, and the next release, 4.0, shared core code with Firefox 4.0. Its features include [[tabbed browsing]], [[password manager]], [[geolocation|location-aware browsing]], and the ability to synchronize with the user's computer Firefox browser using [[Firefox Sync]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/mobile/features/|title=Firefox mobile features|publisher=Mozilla|accessdate=2010-01-30}} The user interface is completely redesigned for small screen optimization, the controls are hidden away so that only the web content is shown on screen and it uses [[touchscreen]] interaction methods in place of dragging actions with a [[mouse (computing)|mouse]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/mobile/features/#touch|title=Firefox Mobile Features Touch Friendly Interface|accessdate=2010-05-26}} ==History== Plugin support was initially disabled by default, removing compatibility with popular web content types such as [[Adobe Flash]].{{cite web|url=http://news.techworld.com/mobile-wireless/3211674/mozilla-releases-firefox-for-mobile-for-maemo-phones/|title=Mozilla releases Firefox for Mobile for Maemo phones|publisher=Techworld|accessdate=2010-02-02}} As of September 2011, Flash support has implemented in pre-release builds for pre-Honeycomb versions of Android.{{cite web|url=https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=630007|title=Support for Flash on Android Fennec|accessdate=2011-09-21}} Release dates: * Version 4: March 29, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://blog.mozilla.com/blog/2011/03/29/mozilla-launches-firefox-4-for-android-allowing-users-to-take-the-power-and-customization-of-firefox-everywhere-2/|title=Mozilla Launches Firefox 4 for Android, Allowing Users to Take the Power and Customization of Firefox Everywhere|accessdate=2011-03-29}} * Version 5: June 21, 2011.[http://www.extremetech.com/computing/87228-firefox-5-for-desktop-and-android-released-firefox-8-before-christmas Firefox 5 for desktop and Android released, Firefox 8 before Christmas] * Version 6: August 16, 2011.[http://blog.mozilla.com/blog/2011/08/16/firefox-for-android-has-a-new-look-and-tools-that-empower-developers-to-build-rich-mobile-web-experiences/ Firefox for Android Has a New Look and Tools that Empower Developers to Build Rich Mobile Web Experiences] * Version 6.0.1: August 30, 2011.[https://developer.mozilla.org/devnews/index.php/2011/08/30/firefox-6-0-1-and-3-6-21-desktop-security-updates-now-available/] * Version 6.0.2: September 6, 2011.[https://developer.mozilla.org/devnews/index.php/2011/09/06/firefox-6-0-2-and-3-6-22-security-updates-now-available//] ==Name== The codename used for Firefox for mobile is Fennec. It comes from the [[Fennec Fox]], a small desert fox (just as the Fennec Browser is a small version of Firefox browser). Firefox for Maemo Beta 5, released in 2009, was the first release to have official Firefox branding, with Firefox name and logo.{{cite web|url=http://blog.mozilla.com/blog/2009/11/09/firefox-for-maemo-beta-5-released/|title=Firefox for Maemo Beta 5 Released}} The browser's version numbering was bumped from version 2.0 to version 4.0 to more closely match desktop releases of Firefox since the rendering engines used in both browsers are the same.{{cite web|url=http://starkravingfinkle.org/blog/2010/09/fennec-4-0-new-and-notable/|title=Fennec 4.0 â New and Notable}} ==Platforms== It is currently available for [[Android (operating system)|Android]] 2.1 and above devices with an ARMv7 CPU{{cite web|url=https://wiki.mozilla.org/Mobile/Platforms/Android#System_Requirements|title=Mobile System Requirements}} and the [[Nokia N900]] [[Maemo (operating system)|Maemo]] device, though version 7 will be the last release for Maemo on the N900.{{cite web|url=https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=681422#c1|title=No updates in Maemo5}} An alpha of version 1.1 for [[Windows Mobile]] is also available.{{cite web|url=http://www.mozilla.org/projects/fennec/1.1a1-wm/releasenotes/|title=Fennec Alpha for Windows Mobile Release Notes}}{{cite web|url=http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/mobile/nightly/2010/03/2010-03-24-01-mobile-1.9.2/|title=Final Fennec Alpha for Windows Mobile 6}} Following the [[Windows Phone 7]] announcement and Microsoft's decision not to release a [[Native Development Kit|native development kit]], development for Windows Mobile was put on hold.{{cite web|url=http://blog.pavlov.net/2010/03/22/stopping-development-for-windows-mobile/|title=Stopping Development for Windows Mobile}} If Microsoft releases a native development kit in the future for its Windows Phone 7 OS, then Mozilla will consider developing Fennec on the Windows Phone platform again. Mozilla has no plans to develop Firefox for Palm's [[WebOS]], although an unofficial port to WebOS has begun.{{cite web|url=http://www.oxymoronical.com/blog/2010/04/Firefox-running-on-the-Palm-Pre-mostly/|title=Firefox running on the Palm Pre (mostly)|publisher=Oxymoronical|date=12 April 2010}} An unofficial port is also available for the [[OpenPandora]] Handheld.{{cite web|url=http://apps.open-pandora.org/cgi-bin/viewapp.pl?/Application/fennec.inf|title=Fennec in the OpenPandora App Store|publisher=OpenPandora|date=29 May 2010}} [[Tristan Nitot]], president of [[Mozilla Europe]], has said that it's unlikely that an [[iPhone]] or a [[BlackBerry]] version will be released, citing [[Apple Inc|Apple's]] non-compete application approval policies and BlackBerry's limited operating system as the reasons.{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/technology/2009/11/09/mozilla-rules-out-firefox-for-iphone-and-blackberry-115875-21809563/|title=Mozilla rules out Firefox for iPhone and BlackBerry}} There are no plans to develop Firefox for the [[Symbian OS|Symbian]] platform. While desktop versions are not supported, versions for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac OS X]] and [[Linux]] are available; these versions are intended as a way to give people who do not have a supported operating system the ability to localize, experiment and build add-ons.{{cite web|url=http://www.mozilla.org/projects/fennec/1.0b5/releasenotes/|title=Fennec Beta 5 for Maemo release notes}}{{cite web|url=http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/mobile/releases/latest/|title=releases for Linux, MacOSX, MSWindows}} ==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} *[[Mobile browser]] *[[Minimo]], a previous project to create a mobile Mozilla browser. *[[MicroB]], a Mozilla-based mobile browser for [[Nokia]] [[Maemo]]. *[[Opera Mobile]] *[[Opera Mini]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons|Category:Mozilla Fennec}} *[http://www.mozilla.com/mobile/ Firefox for mobile Website] *[https://wiki.mozilla.org/Mobile Mobile mozilla wiki page] *[https://wiki.mozilla.org/Fennec Fennec mozilla wiki page] {{Mozilla projects}} {{Web browsers}} {{gopher clients}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Firefox For Mobile}} [[Category:Gopher clients]] [[Category:Firefox]] [[Category:Mobile browsers]] [[Category:Windows Mobile Standard software]] [[Category:Pocket PC software]] [[Category:Gecko-based software]] [[ar:ÙÙØ²ÙÙØ§ ÙÙÙ]] [[de:Mozilla Firefox Mobile]] [[es:Firefox MÃ³vil]] [[eu:Mozilla Fennec]] [[fa:ÙØ§ÛØ±ÙØ§Ú©Ø³ Ø¨Ø±Ø§Û ØªÙÙÙ ÙÙØ±Ø§Ù]] [[fr:Firefox Mobile]] [[ko:ëª¨ì§ë¼ íì´ì´í­ì¤ ëª¨ë°ì¼]] [[it:Firefox mobile]] [[he:Firefox for mobile]] [[hu:Mozilla Fennec]] [[mr:à¤®à¥à¤¬à¤¾à¤à¤²à¤¸à¤¾à¤ à¥à¤à¤¾ à¤«à¤¾à¤¯à¤°à¤«à¥à¤à¥à¤¸]] [[nl:Firefox for mobile]] [[ja:Firefox for Mobile]] [[pl:Fennec]] [[pt:Firefox for mobile]] [[ro:Mozilla Fennec]] [[ru:ÐÐ¾Ð±Ð¸Ð»ÑÐ½ÑÐ¹ Firefox]] [[fi:Firefox Mobile]] [[sv:Mozilla Fennec]] [[uk:Firefox for mobile]] [[vi:Mozilla Fennec]] [[zh:Firefox for mobile]]
